properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Sandia/Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 4:48AM MST until January 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND
A WINTRY MIX TO PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN PLAINS TODAY...TONIGHT AND
INTO FRIDAY...

.A complex winter storm system will bring accumulating snow to
northern New Mexico. The highest snow accumulations will be found
above 7500 feet with accumulations ranging from 5 to 10 inches
and over a foot possible on mountain peaks. Very strong westerly
winds on Friday will also create areas of reduced visibilities in
blowing snow across the northern high terrain. Areas of freezing
rain will be possible across portions of mainly the east central
plains this morning and again this evening. For the latest New
Mexico road conditions call 511 or visit nmroads.com.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, except up to 10 to 12 inches
above 7500 feet. Ice accumulations of around one tenth of an
inch are possible. West to northwest winds will gust as high as
55 mph on Friday resulting in areas of reduced visibilities in
blowing snow at the higher mountain passes.

* WHERE...Sangre de Cristo, Tusas and Jemez Mountains, Sandia and
Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood, Far Northwest Highlands,
and Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds could
cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel on State Road 38 through Bobcat
Pass, Highway 64 from Taos to Cimarron, as well as Interstate 25
at Glorieta Pass and Interstate 40 through Tijeras Canyon will
be impacted.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY
